data.prayer: Jesus, please give your people in Wajir, Kenya a passion for the lost.
data.verse: We are therefore Christ’s ambassadors, as though God were making his appeal through us. We implore you on Christ’s behalf: Be reconciled to God.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Wajir, Kenya
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Father, thank you that in your kindness you have made every believer in Wajir, Kenya a priest, who can offer spiritual sacrifices to you through Jesus.
data.verse: Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit. He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”

data.prayer: Spirit, sanctify the 328,330 believers in Wajir and keep them blameless until Jesus returns.
data.verse: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. He who calls you is faithful, who will also do it.

data.prayer: Jesus, call those who are far off in Wajir, Kenya, so that they and their family can receive life.
data.verse: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.

data.prayer: Lord, please remember the Munyoyaya people. you said you wanted worshippers of every tongue and tribe and nation, yet we know of no worshippers among them.
Jesus, strengthen the church in Wajir, Kenya by giving a prophet, as you said you would, who is bold and willing to correct. Lord, may the believers care about holiness as you do.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Father, you desire the people in the state of Wajir who are far from you to hear about you.
data.verse: "Those who were not told about him will see, and those who have not heard will understand."

data.prayer: Father, like with the Ethiopian Eunuch, set up a meeting today between a faithful believer in Wajir, Kenya and a person seeking to understand the truth.
data.verse: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?” Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

location.name: Wajir
location.people_groups_list: Oromo, Sakuye, Hindi, Gujarati, Punjabi, Midgan
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Oromo, Sakuye (35,000), Hindi (6,700), Gujarati (212,000), Punjabi (67,000), Midgan (2,600)
